sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the Ramsey number R(3,4)?
message_2: The Ramsey number R(3,4) is the smallest integer N such that any graph with N vertices will contain either a clique of size 3 (a triangle) or an independent set of size 4 (a set of 4 vertices with no edges between them). The Ramsey number R(3,4) is known to be 9.
